definition: ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: He said that his nickname is "Toshomen, " you want to know her?
sentences.chinese: 他說自己的外號是“刀削麪”，你想認識她嗎？

sentences.english: Their children have been nicknamed the "rich second generation".
sentences.chinese: 企業家的孩子也得了外號“富二代”。

sentences.english: Over the years, Seattle has inspired a number of nicknames.
sentences.chinese: 多年來，人們給西雅圖起過不少外號。

sentences.english: To me it wasn't an insult; I rather like the nickname Lucy.
sentences.chinese: 我不覺得這個外號是一種侮辱，反倒很喜歡它。

sentences.english: His political nickname, at the time, was Bambi.
sentences.chinese: 那時候，他的政治外號是“小鹿斑比“。

sentences.english: The other kids used to call me names.
sentences.chinese: 那些小孩過去常給我起外號。

sentences.english: He was named  as the female.
Who knows the exit in later 5566 nickname knife?
sentences.chinese: 誰知道5566裏後來退出的那個外號小刀的？

sentences.english: Peter learned to turn himself into a rat and used the nickname "Wormtail."
sentences.chinese: 彼德學習變成一個老鼠並使用蟲尾巴這個外號。

sentences.english: Many classmates remove monicker to cry to me ' steamed bread elder brother ' .
sentences.chinese: 不少同學給我起外號叫‘饅頭哥’呢。

sentences.english: He doesn’t like others to call him by his nickname.
sentences.chinese: 他不喜歡別人叫他的外號。

sentences.english: A movie's name and her monicker are the same.
sentences.chinese: 一部電影的名字與她的外號相同。

sentences.english: How could elks have a nickname?
Farley, whose nickname is Fudge, is always in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 法利的外號是“小淘氣”，他經常鬧出麻煩。

sentences.english: At that time, I have a nickname, the fine-sounding name, "Daisen barefoot."
sentences.chinese: 那時候，我有一個外號，名曰“赤腳大仙”。

sentences.english: That one with the UFC and his nickname is Bad Boy.
sentences.chinese: 就是那個打UFC的，外號是壞小子的那個。

definition: (coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
son of the boss/young master of the house/your son (honorific)
a favorite of sb in power/a celebrity/American Indian
to be keen on/to have a passion for
girl/servant girl/(used deprecatingly, but sometimes also as a term of endearment)
